title: Agency Use of ADR for EEO Dispute Resolution in FY 2009

In order to have met the federal 2% participation rate goal, 506 IWTD were needed. This represents an increase of 9 employees over FY 2008 and a decrease of 12 employees since FY 2005. The participation rate for FY 2008 was 1.78% and for FY 2005 was 2.00%. Over the 5-year period DLA had a net decrease of 0.35% in employees with targeted disabilities.}
textBeforeTable: DLA agreed to pay a total of $429,273 plus other benefits for 32 complaint closures through settlement agreements, final agency decisions, and final agency orders fully implementing AJ decisions. For complaint closures with monetary benefits, the average award was $13,415. DLA agreed to pay $14,728 for 35 pre-complaint settlements, of which 1 was a monetary settlement averaging $14,728. DLA expended a total of $412,727 for 63 complaint investigations, for an average expenditure of $6,551. IV. Costs DLA's average processing time for all complaint closures decreased from 564 days in FY 2008 to 329 days in FY 2009. The government-wide average was 344 days. Of the 63 completed investigations, 33.3% were timely. DLA's average time for completing an investigation was 214 days. Of the agencies completing 25 or more investigations, the Tennessee Valley Authority had the lowest average of 100 days. III. Complaint Processing Times The bases of alleged discrimination most often raised were: (1) Age; (2) Reprisal; and (3) Race (Black/African American). Of the 110 complaints filed at DLA, 37 contained allegations of race (Black/African American) discrimination, 10 contained allegations of race (White) discrimination, 3 contained allegations of race (Asian) discrimination, 22 contained allegations of color discrimination and 38 contained allegations of disability discrimination. II. Bases of Complaints Filed DLA timely processed 77% of the 256 pre-complaint counselings (without remands) completed in FY 2009. I.
